Detect non-interactive stdin in doctor confirmations
description: When bd doctor --fix or bd doctor --validate are run in non-interactive environments (e.g., CI pipelines, piped stdin), the confirmation prompts hang waiting for input that never comes. Even though --yes flag exists as a workaround, users may forget it or not know about it. Need to detect isatty() on stdin (similar to mybd-wan's gitHasUpstream() pattern) and skip prompts when running non-interactively. This follows the principle that bd commands should work seamlessly in automated contexts without requiring special flags.
design: doctor fix/validate commands hang when stdin is piped (non-TTY) without --yes flag. Solution: Detect isatty() on stdin like gitHasUpstream() pattern. Skip prompts if !isatty(). Affected files: doctor_fix.go line 82, doctor_validate.go line 156.

title: validate all bd cli commands
description: Perform a comprehensive audit of the `bd` command suite. Start by identifying and ranking all available commands based on operational importance and frequency of use, grouping those of equal rank. Iterate through the commands in order of priority to conduct a three-point inspection: verify the existence and currency of tests, execute the command to validate functionality against expected behavior, and identify any deviations. Create an issue for every anomaly or gap discovered using `bd`. Continuously monitor the context window; as usage approaches the 70% soft limit, proactively spawn sub-agents to handle subsequent command audits, ensuring the process completes without context loss.
